Strategic Planning & Brand Management

Develop, implement, and oversee integrated marketing plans aligned with the company’s business objectives.
Drive brand positioning and ensure consistent messaging across all marketing channels.
Lead product portfolio strategy, ensuring alignment with consumer needs and market trends.
Manage the brand budget to ensure optimal ROI on marketing initiatives.

Market Research & Consumer Insights

Analyze sales data, market share, and consumer behavior to guide strategic decision-making.
Translate research insights into actionable marketing strategies that strengthen brand performance.

Product Development & Go-to-Market Execution

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (production, R&D, sales, and finance) to ensure successful product rollouts.
Oversee packaging design, pricing strategies, and promotional campaigns for new and existing products.
Monitor and evaluate product performance post-launch and implement corrective actions as needed.

Advertising, Promotions & Digital Marketing

Develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns across digital, traditional, and in-store platforms.
Manage media planning and buying to ensure effective reach and engagement.
Oversee the creation of promotional materials and marketing collateral.
Strengthen the company’s online presence through social media and digital marketing strategies.

Leadership & Team Management

Supervise, mentor, and develop the marketing team to achieve departmental goals.
Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners (agencies, suppliers, distributors).
Champion innovation and creativity within the marketing function.

MBA or Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.

Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Procurement Planning & Sourcing

Develop and implement effective procurement plans to support production and operational needs.
Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Maintain and update an approved supplier list in line with company policies.
Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Strategic Planning & Brand Management

Develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies aligned with the company’s objectives and brand positioning.
Manage and enhance brand identity across all platforms, ensuring consistency in tone, visuals, and messaging.
Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and target audiences in the fashion industry.

Digital Marketing & Advertising

Plan and execute digital marketing campaigns across social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, X, YouTube, etc.).
Oversee the creation of engaging and high-quality digital content including visuals, videos, and copywriting.
Manage Google Ads, SEO/SEM strategies, and email marketing to drive online visibility and sales conversions.
Track, measure, and report on the performance of all digital campaigns using analytics tools (Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, etc.).

Sales & Promotion Campaigns

Design and execute creative promotional campaigns, collaborations, and influencer partnerships to boost brand engagement.
Coordinate fashion events, launches, and pop-ups to enhance customer experience and brand awareness.
Work closely with the sales team to align marketing initiatives with sales goals and seasonal collections.

Leadership & Team Collaboration

Supervise and mentor junior marketing staff, photographers, designers, and social media coordinators.
Liaise with internal departments (Design, Sales, Production) to ensure cohesive brand messaging and timely campaign execution.
Manage marketing budgets efficiently and prepare monthly reports on marketing performance and ROI.

Customer Engagement & Analytics

Monitor customer feedback and online engagement to identify areas for improvement.
Utilize data-driven insights to refine marketing strategies and improve customer acquisition and retention.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Public Relations, or a related field.
Minimum 3–5 years’ proven experience in marketing or brand management within the fashion industry.
Strong knowledge of digital marketing, SEO, social media marketing, Google Ads, and content marketing.
Proficiency in design and marketing tools such as Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, Google Analytics, and Meta Business Suite.
Excellent communication, presentation, and leadership skills.
Creative, trend-savvy, and capable of developing fresh, innovative marketing ideas for fashion brands.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Procurement Planning & Sourcing

Develop and implement effective procurement plans to support production and operational needs.
Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Maintain and update an approved supplier list in line with company policies.
Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills

Provide guidance on best practices for stock handling, storage, and documentation.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Procurement Planning & Sourcing

Develop and implement effective procurement plans to support production and operational needs.
Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Maintain and update an approved supplier list in line with company policies.
Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Inventory Management:

Maintain accurate records of all stock items, including receipts, issues, returns, and transfers.
Monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal stock availability and prevent overstocking or stockouts.
Classify and organize stock in the warehouse for easy retrieval and minimal losses.

Stock Movement Monitoring:

Track the movement of goods into and out of the warehouse.
Reconcile physical stock with system records regularly and investigate any discrepancies.
Implement FIFO (First In, First Out) or other inventory rotation methods to minimize expiry or obsolescence.

Documentation & Reporting:

Maintain proper documentation for all stock transactions in line with company policies.
Prepare and submit regular inventory reports to management, highlighting stock levels, variances, and trends.
Assist in audits by providing accurate stock records and supporting documentation.

Warehouse Operations:

Ensure the warehouse is clean, organized, and compliant with safety standards.
Supervise warehouse staff in proper stock handling, storage, and packaging.
Coordinate with transport/logistics teams to ensure timely delivery of stock to various locations.

Coordination & Collaboration:

Work closely with the procurement and supply chain teams to forecast inventory needs.
Support the finance team by providing accurate stock valuations and documentation.
Liaise with suppliers and vendors for stock deliveries and resolve any discrepancies.

Process Improvement:

Identify opportunities to improve stock management processes, reduce wastage, and increase efficiency.
Assist in implementing or upgrading stock management software/ERP systems.
Conduct periodic reviews of inventory procedures and recommend improvements.

Team Supervision & Training:

Mentor and supervise junior warehouse staff or assistants.
Provide guidance on best practices for stock handling, storage, and documentation.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or a related field.
Minimum of 2–3 years of experience in inventory, stock, or warehouse management.
Proficiency in stock management software, ERP systems, or inventory control tools.
Strong numerical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent organizational and documentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Strategic Planning & Brand Management

Develop, implement, and oversee integrated marketing plans aligned with the company’s business objectives.
Drive brand positioning and ensure consistent messaging across all marketing channels.
Lead product portfolio strategy, ensuring alignment with consumer needs and market trends.
Manage the brand budget to ensure optimal ROI on marketing initiatives.

Market Research & Consumer Insights

Conduct regular market research to identify trends, consumer preferences, and competitive dynamics.
Analyze sales data, market share, and consumer behavior to guide strategic decision-making.
Translate research insights into actionable marketing strategies that strengthen brand performance.

Product Development & Go-to-Market Execution

Lead go-to-market (GTM) strategies for new product launches, from concept development to commercialization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (production, R&D, sales, and finance) to ensure successful product rollouts.
Oversee packaging design, pricing strategies, and promotional campaigns for new and existing products.
Monitor and evaluate product performance post-launch and implement corrective actions as needed.

Advertising, Promotions & Digital Marketing

Develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns across digital, traditional, and in-store platforms.
Manage media planning and buying to ensure effective reach and engagement.
Oversee the creation of promotional materials and marketing collateral.
Strengthen the company’s online presence through social media and digital marketing strategies.

Leadership & Team Management

Supervise, mentor, and develop the marketing team to achieve departmental goals.
Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners (agencies, suppliers, distributors).
Champion innovation and creativity within the marketing function.

Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Procurement Planning & Sourcing

Develop and implement effective procurement plans to support production and operational needs.
Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Maintain and update an approved supplier list in line with company policies.
Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills

Develop, implement, and oversee integrated marketing plans aligned with the company’s business objectives.
Drive brand positioning and ensure consistent messaging across all marketing channels.
Lead product portfolio strategy, ensuring alignment with consumer needs and market trends.
Manage the brand budget to ensure optimal ROI on marketing initiatives.

Market Research & Consumer Insights

Conduct regular market research to identify trends, consumer preferences, and competitive dynamics.
Analyze sales data, market share, and consumer behavior to guide strategic decision-making.
Translate research insights into actionable marketing strategies that strengthen brand performance.

Product Development & Go-to-Market Execution

Lead go-to-market (GTM) strategies for new product launches, from concept development to commercialization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (production, R&D, sales, and finance) to ensure successful product rollouts.
Oversee packaging design, pricing strategies, and promotional campaigns for new and existing products.
Monitor and evaluate product performance post-launch and implement corrective actions as needed.

Advertising, Promotions & Digital Marketing

Develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns across digital, traditional, and in-store platforms.
Manage media planning and buying to ensure effective reach and engagement.
Oversee the creation of promotional materials and marketing collateral.
Strengthen the company’s online presence through social media and digital marketing strategies.

Leadership & Team Management

Supervise, mentor, and develop the marketing team to achieve departmental goals.
Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners (agencies, suppliers, distributors).
Champion innovation and creativity within the marketing function.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
MBA or Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 10 years’ experience in FMCG marketing, preferably within the beverage industry (tea, coffee, or similar).
Proven track record in brand building, product marketing, and strategic planning.
Demonstrated success in developing and launching new products in competitive markets.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and convert insights into strategy.
Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills.
jobs.how_to_apply:
If you meet the above qualifications, skills and experience share CV on: hr@jobvacancy.co.ke
Interviews will be carried out on a rolling basis until the position is filled.
Only the shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Procurement Planning & Sourcing

Develop and implement effective procurement plans to support production and operational needs.
Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Maintain and update an approved supplier list in line with company policies.
Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills
jobs.how_to_apply:
If you meet the above qualifications, skills and experience share CV on: hr@jobvacancy.co.ke
Interviews will be carried out on a rolling basis until the position is filled.
Only the shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Report observations to management to help refine sales strategies.

Educate customers on proper usage of products to maximize satisfaction.

Negotiate terms of sales agreements to ensure mutually beneficial outcomes.
Maintain accurate records of sales, client interactions, and follow-ups.
Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly sales reports for management review.
Use CRM or other sales tools to track leads, opportunities, and sales progress.
Work closely with the marketing team to implement promotional campaigns.
Coordinate with logistics and supply chain teams to ensure timely delivery of products.
Participate in sales meetings, training sessions, and strategy discussions.
Continuously update knowledge of products, market trends, and sales techniques.
Attend workshops, training, or seminars to enhance selling skills.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:

Proven sales experience, preferably in FMCG, retail, or similar industries.
Strong understanding of sales principles, customer service, and market dynamics.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Self-motivated, target-driven, and capable of working independently or as part of a team.
Ability to handle multiple clients and prioritize tasks effectively.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and basic CRM tools is an advantage.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Financial Accounting and Reporting

Prepare, review, and maintain accurate financial records in line with accounting standards and company policies.
Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
Perform bank reconciliations, supplier reconciliations, and other control account reconciliations.
Support the month-end and year-end closing processes.

Accounts Payable & Receivable

Process supplier invoices, verify supporting documentation, and ensure timely payments.
Manage customer invoicing, collections, and credit control processes.
Maintain accurate AP/AR aging reports and follow up on outstanding balances.

Taxation and Compliance

Prepare and file statutory returns including VAT, PAYE, Withholding Tax, and Corporate Tax in accordance with KRA regulations.
Ensure compliance with tax laws and provide support during tax audits.
Liaise with external auditors and regulatory bodies as required.

Inventory and Cost Accounting

Work closely with the procurement and warehouse teams to maintain accurate inventory valuation and cost tracking.
Analyze variances between physical stock and system records, and recommend corrective actions.
Support cost analysis and margin reporting for management decision-making.

ERP and Systems Management

Utilize ERP/accounting systems for data entry, reporting, and analysis.
Support system enhancements, ensuring data integrity and accurate financial reporting.

Internal Controls and Process Improvement

Ensure proper documentation and adherence to internal control procedures.
Identify process inefficiencies and recommend improvements.

CPA (Kenya) qualification – minimum CPA Section 4 or higher.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a busy accounting environment.

Proven experience in tax compliance and statutory filings.
Proficiency in ERP/accounting software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, QuickBooks, or similar).

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Inventory Management:

Maintain accurate records of all stock items, including receipts, issues, returns, and transfers.
Monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal stock availability and prevent overstocking or stockouts.
Classify and organize stock in the warehouse for easy retrieval and minimal losses.

Stock Movement Monitoring:

Track the movement of goods into and out of the warehouse.
Reconcile physical stock with system records regularly and investigate any discrepancies.
Implement FIFO (First In, First Out) or other inventory rotation methods to minimize expiry or obsolescence.

Documentation & Reporting:

Maintain proper documentation for all stock transactions in line with company policies.
Prepare and submit regular inventory reports to management, highlighting stock levels, variances, and trends.
Assist in audits by providing accurate stock records and supporting documentation.

Warehouse Operations:

Ensure the warehouse is clean, organized, and compliant with safety standards.

Develop and implement effective procurement plans to support production and operational needs.
Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers based on quality, reliability, and cost parameters.
Obtain and analyze quotations to ensure best value for money while maintaining quality standards.

Supplier Management

Maintain and update an approved supplier list in line with company policies.
Conduct and support supplier evaluations and audits to ensure compliance with food safety and quality standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO, FSSC 22000).
Build strong supplier relationships and manage performance through regular reviews.

Procurement Operations

Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) and follow up to ensure timely delivery.
Maintain accurate procurement documentation and records for audit and traceability purposes.
Track inventory levels and collaborate with stores and production teams to avoid stockouts or overstocking.
Handle supplier payments in collaboration with the finance department and ensure proper reconciliation.

Compliance & Risk Management

Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and statutory regulations.
Monitor market trends, pricing fluctuations, and risks affecting supply continuity.
Participate in internal and external audits related to procurement and supplier management.

Systems & Reporting

Utilize ERP systems for procurement planning, purchase order management, and supplier data updates.
Generate and analyze procurement reports to support decision-making and cost optimization.
Continuously improve procurement processes to enhance efficiency and transparency.
jobs.key_requirements_skills_qualification:
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
KISM, CIPS, or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in procurement, preferably in a food processing or manufacturing industry
Sound understanding of food safety standards and supplier audit processes
Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar)
Strong negotiation, analytical, and vendor management skills
jobs.how_to_apply:
If you meet the above qualifications, skills and experience share CV on: hr@jobvacancy.co.ke
Interviews will be carried out on a rolling basis until the position is filled.
Only the shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Continuously update knowledge of products, market trends, and sales techniques.
Attend workshops, training, or seminars to enhance selling skills.

Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
Perform bank reconciliations, supplier reconciliations, and other control account reconciliations.
Support the month-end and year-end closing processes.

Accounts Payable & Receivable

Process supplier invoices, verify supporting documentation, and ensure timely payments.
Manage customer invoicing, collections, and credit control processes.

Work closely with the procurement and warehouse teams to maintain accurate inventory valuation and cost tracking.
Analyze variances between physical stock and system records, and recommend corrective actions.
Support cost analysis and margin reporting for management decision-making.

ERP and Systems Management

Utilize ERP/accounting systems for data entry, reporting, and analysis.
Support system enhancements, ensuring data integrity and accurate financial reporting.

Internal Controls and Process Improvement

Ensure proper documentation and adherence to internal control procedures.
Identify process inefficiencies and recommend improvements.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Inventory Management:

Maintain accurate records of all stock items, including receipts, issues, returns, and transfers.
Monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal stock availability and prevent overstocking or stockouts.
Classify and organize stock in the warehouse for easy retrieval and minimal losses.

Stock Movement Monitoring:

Track the movement of goods into and out of the warehouse.
Reconcile physical stock with system records regularly and investigate any discrepancies.
Implement FIFO (First In, First Out) or other inventory rotation methods to minimize expiry or obsolescence.

Documentation & Reporting:

Maintain proper documentation for all stock transactions in line with company policies.
Prepare and submit regular inventory reports to management, highlighting stock levels, variances, and trends.
Assist in audits by providing accurate stock records and supporting documentation.

Warehouse Operations:

Ensure the warehouse is clean, organized, and compliant with safety standards.
Supervise warehouse staff in proper stock handling, storage, and packaging.
Coordinate with transport/logistics teams to ensure timely delivery of stock to various locations.

Coordination & Collaboration:

Work closely with the procurement and supply chain teams to forecast inventory needs.
Support the finance team by providing accurate stock valuations and documentation.
Liaise with suppliers and vendors for stock deliveries and resolve any discrepancies.

Process Improvement:

Identify opportunities to improve stock management processes, reduce wastage, and increase efficiency.
Assist in implementing or upgrading stock management software/ERP systems.
Conduct periodic reviews of inventory procedures and recommend improvements.

Team Supervision & Training:

Mentor and supervise junior warehouse staff or assistants.
Provide guidance on best practices for stock handling, storage, and documentation.

Minimum of 2–3 years of experience in inventory, stock, or warehouse management.
Proficiency in stock management software, ERP systems, or inventory control tools.
Strong numerical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent organizational and documentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Financial Record Management

Maintain and update the general ledger, ensuring all financial transactions are accurately recorded.
Prepare and post journal entries and reconciliations, including month-end and year-end closing processes.
Monitor and manage accounts payable and receivable to ensure timely processing and cash flow management.

Inventory and Cost Accounting

Oversee inventory valuation and reconciliation processes in line with manufacturing operations.
Track and analyze production costs, including raw materials, labor, and overheads, to assist in pricing and profitability analysis.
Work closely with the production and procurement teams to ensure accurate recording of inventory movements and stock levels.

Tax Compliance and Reporting

Ensure compliance with all Kenyan tax regulations including VAT, PAYE, withholding taxes, and corporate taxes.
Prepare and file statutory tax returns and reports accurately and on time.
Liaise with tax authorities and external auditors during tax audits and reviews.

Financial Reporting and Analysis

Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in compliance with accounting standards and company policies.
Provide financial analysis and variance explanations to management to support business decisions.
Monitor budget adherence and report discrepancies or potential risks.

 
 
Audit and Controls

Implement audit recommendations and ensure strong internal controls to safeguard company assets.
Continuously improve accounting procedures and internal controls to enhance efficiency and compliance.

Cross-functional Collaboration

Work closely with manufacturing, procurement, and sales teams to ensure financial processes support operational requirements.
Provide financial insights and advice to department heads to improve cost efficiency and profitability.

jobs.duties_and_responsibilities:
Daily Accounting Entries and Bookkeeping

Accurately record all daily financial transactions in Microsoft Dynamics Navision, ensuring that all entries are complete and error-free.
Maintain the general ledger by posting journal entries, including accruals, prepayments, and other adjusting entries as required.
Review and verify accounting data for accuracy and completeness before posting.
Ensure all accounting entries comply with company policies and accounting standards.

Account Reconciliation

Perform regular reconciliations of bank accounts, supplier statements, and customer accounts to ensure all records are accurate and up to date.
Investigate and resolve discrepancies or irregularities in reconciliations, escalating issues to senior accountants or management as necessary.
Monitor and maintain an aging schedule for accounts receivable and payable, following up on overdue accounts to ensure timely payments and collections.

Management Reporting

Prepare and compile monthly financial statements and management reports, including profit and loss accounts, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
Assist in analyzing financial data to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for cost savings or efficiency improvements.
Support senior finance staff in budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.

Accounts Payable and Receivable Management

Manage supplier invoices and process payments accurately and timely, ensuring compliance with payment terms.
Issue and track customer invoices, follow up on overdue payments, and maintain records of all transactions in the accounting system.
Liaise with vendors and customers to resolve billing queries or payment issues efficiently.

Compliance and Statutory Requirements

Ensure all financial operations comply with statutory regulations, including VAT filings, withholding tax, and other relevant tax obligations.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of applicable accounting standards, tax laws, and regulations.
Prepare and submit reports to regulatory bodies as required.

Audit Preparation and Support

Assist in the preparation and coordination of documentation and schedules required for internal and external audits.
Provide auditors with explanations and supporting documents as needed during the audit process.
Implement audit recommendations and ensure corrective actions are taken in a timely manner.

Financial Controls and Process Improvement

Help maintain and improve internal controls to safeguard company assets and ensure the integrity of financial data.
Participate in the development and review of accounting policies and procedures to improve efficiency and compliance.
Identify opportunities for automation or process improvements within the accounting function, particularly leveraging features in Microsoft Dynamics Navision.

Team Collaboration and Communication

Work closely with other departments such as procurement, sales, and operations to ensure smooth financial workflows.
Provide support and guidance to junior accounting staff or interns, if applicable.
Communicate effectively with management and colleagues to support financial decision-making.
